padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1592539">Hamza_Chaudry03</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-04">12/04/23 11:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a dumb-reach fragrance for me. Ideal for work, going out for errands, school, gym, etc. . . Over-all pleasant, clean and uplifting. I also spray it at home after showering because it makes me feel so relaxed </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1992278"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1992278#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1989757" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1989757" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alexandris"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1876338"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1876338.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alexandris" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1989757ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1989757" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1876338">alexandris</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-01">12/01/23 08:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A minimalist and beautiful scent. Somewhat medicinal due to lavender and musk but carries just enough sweetness to pull off in any environment. <br />
<br />
You can wear it to office, to daily errands and even to bar-hopping night outs. I wore this for longer than 3 years in university. I wore it to classes, night outs, boys nights, weddings and even clubs. Women always liked this one.<br />
And if you are a neat, charismatic, open minded and likeable person, you can pull this off like no other. <br />
<br />
A spring-summer-early fall scent. Moderate longevity and moderate-to-intimate projection. You can go trigger happy with this one since it smells just natural and safe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1989757"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1989757#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1983605" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1983605" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alecrangosauro"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1804799"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="alecrangosauro" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1983605ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1983605" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1804799">alecrangosauro</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-23">11/23/23 13:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is amazing! I wear this to work almost every day when it's hot. I love mint and lavender, and those notes are honestly the most noticeable when I smell this on myself. It smells so clean, fresh, and irresistible! It's very office-friendly and safe. I also get pretty decent longevity out of this. 9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1983605"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1983605#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1982836" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1982836" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iluvcheeseburgers"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1897438"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="iluvcheeseburgers" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Spicebomb-13857.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13857.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spicebomb"title="Spicebomb"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1982836ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1982836" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1897438">iluvcheeseburgers</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-22">11/22/23 13:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Natural smelling, well blended, fresh, and clean. Its a lavender bomb, then its clean laundry. It smells classy. Projection is very weak and Its a skin scent after 2 hours. Appropriate for any occasion or any season.<br />
 Mine is batch code: 91471<br />
<br />
 First 10 minutes = zesty bitter orange and medicinal lavender. <br />
Next 20 minutes = sweet, herbal lavender and sweet clary sage. <br />
Next 30 minutes = spearmint chewing gum and herbal lavender. <br />
Next 60 minutes = laundry dryer sheets</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1982836"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1982836#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979962" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979962" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dantar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1474653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1474653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dantar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979962ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979962" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1474653">dantar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-19">11/19/23 00:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very modest lavender and mint, Id totally wear this to bed.The sillage wasnt HUGE on me, but thats not a bad thing. Its like you just stepped out of a shower but not overly soapy. Kinda clean girl but on a dude. I love that its a step away from that generic really in your face aquatic scent that mens cologne always seem to have.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1979962"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1979962#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1978570" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1978570" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheodoreMnts"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1876922"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1876922.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheodoreMnts" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1978570ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1978570" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1876922">TheodoreMnts</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-17">11/17/23 01:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I preferred how it smelled during the dry down over when it was first sprayed. In the Philippines where we still wear face masks and use a lot of alcohol (in the aspect of health and hygiene). This reminds me of the better scented alcohol products</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1978570"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1978570#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1978095" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1978095" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Slimshadybaby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1472460"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Slimshadybaby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1978095ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1978095" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1472460">Slimshadybaby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-16">11/16/23 11:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My fragrantica rating is a 4.30. <br />
<br />
 On a tester strip, I agree with general comments about it smelling like a soapy lavender scent with orange rind - I'm imagining a Baylis &amp; Harding branded soap in a an upmarket hotel or restaurant (a nice smell but not what you imagine as attractive). <br />
 On skin, this smell is incredibly masculine and attractive. It is inoffensive, you do smell like you have a modern city apartment that you keep clean, it is suited for office wear... and women find it very attractive in all ways different to how a sexy fragrance is marketed. <br />
 Lavender, orange rind, clary sage and ambroxan are the foundations of what on skin is an assertively masculine, clean and sexy scent. Women love it - smelling clean, tidy and as if you have everything in order is pure masculine sexiness. It smells greener on skin than on a test strip (but is so well balanced and blended that it is not overtly green and is supported by a slightly sweet undertone possibly coming from the coumarin).<br />
<br />
 Sillage is good if not very good. Nearly all fragrances last longer on me because I'm fit and healthy so I can't comment on its general longevity but can tell you it has lasted me over 12 hours with 4 sprays - 3 on the neck and 1 on the wrist. Bottle has nice glass, great atomizer but the metal aesthetic is cheap plastic but looks good from a distance on the cabinet.<br />
<br />
 Very impressed and has the market advantage of not being so popular compared to blue fragrances currently. <br />
<br />
 Modern, masculine and sexy. <br />
 Suitable for indoor and outdoor ventures in the spring, summer and autumn. <br />
 A day scent that can be used in the evenings by cutting through the chilly night.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1978095"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1978095#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1973703" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1973703" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kanaerion47"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1611692"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kanaerion47" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1973703ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1973703" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1611692">kanaerion47</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-10">11/10/23 17:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a pleasant, soapy, relaxing scent, but it doesn't really smell like cologne. It reminds me of lotions, hand creams, certain sunscreens, spas etc. Somewhat medicinal too. You'll probably get compliments for it, but more because you smell clean than because you smell sexy. I imagine a doctor wearing it. Can't really think of what situations it fits, like I said it doesn't really smell like a fragrance. Office maybe if you wanna be as safe as possible?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1973703"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1973703#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1967387" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1967387" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Brender"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1869984"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1869984.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Brender" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1967387ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1967387" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1869984">Brender</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-02">11/02/23 23:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Good soapy lavender and sage. It's very minimalistic and serves it's purpose well. This thing says "I shower and iron my clothes every day" and combining it with actually doing that will make you the freshest person in the room. This thing does very little to stand out, but it also results in me having no real complaints. For some it's the master of mid, but for fresh boys it's iconic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1967387"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1967387#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1965326" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1965326" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Marshzcents"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1768322"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1768322.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Marshzcents" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Coach/Coach-Blue-60332.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60332.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coach Blue"title="Coach Blue"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1965326ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1965326" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1768322">Marshzcents</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-31">10/31/23 14:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like this fragrance a lot, the sage is very noticeable and of course, as Prada does, the soapiness of the lavender is amazing, this is a great masculine modern fragrance. I don't know how people hate on this for being simple, sometimes that's a good thing in my opinion. I hate how much I like Prada fragrances because they don't last much on my skin, I swear lol. I used to have Prada L'homme Intense, an 8hr amber heavy fragrance and it would last I kid you not 10 minutes on my skin, this is the same case. People say this is long lasting but I only get 2-3 hours max, with moderate projection so I guess that's really good! </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1965326"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1965326#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1961562" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1961562" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jessetn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1732172"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jessetn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1961562ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1961562" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1732172">jessetn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-26">10/26/23 12:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>its perfect for its purpose.<br />
not the most creative or complex scent but really reliable. <br />
i think its blended really well. slight citrus with lavender and mint. got a nice slight creaminess to it as well<br />
incredibly clean, fresh, and sophisticated. classic</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1961562"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1961562#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1959133" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1959133" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jose_marquez123"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1695988"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jose_marquez123" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1959133ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1959133" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1695988">jose_marquez123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-23">10/23/23 14:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful perfume, it is really great to appreciate the progress of the notes. It starts a little bit sharp, then you'll have a very nice lavender with sage that will make you remember 212 Carolina Herrera, but this one ends like no other perfume, with a very special clean soapy smell, only Prada can do it like this. It's good for office, but it's the best for romantic dates, your girlfriend/wife will love to be close to your neck!!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1959133"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1959133#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1954859" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1954859" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Matasta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1868092"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Matasta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1954859ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1954859" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1868092">Matasta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-18">10/18/23 05:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Many people tend to rate this one a bit lower due to a lack of complexity to satisfy their needs. I feel that we should judge a fragrance by its purpose and how well it executes it. This is a no-brainer pick-and-go fragrance, something fresh and alluring that makes people genuinely complement you. I use this all through summer and spring sometimes fall too, mostly mornings. The reason I like this the most is because it's inviting, especially in university, its not cloying, its not harsh to the nose, and everytime I sit next to anyone they say wow you smell amazing (Its meant for close proximity tasks (around 2 forearm lengths away), if I'm in a work meeting, or at uni, people compliment that its not  overpowering and headache-inducing. I rate this a 9/10. It is deducted a point due to its market price, around $139 AU for 100ml, which is OK. I feel like the Fragrantica rating should be 4.20 to 4.30.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1954859"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1954859#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1951295" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1951295" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Realest Rater 47"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740776"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1740776.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Realest Rater 47" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1951295ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1951295" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740776">Realest Rater 47</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-13">10/13/23 19:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This makes you smell like you have very good hygiene</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1951295"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1951295#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1946664" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1946664" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="seidavee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1450424"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1450424.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="seidavee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1946664ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1946664" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1450424">seidavee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-07">10/07/23 17:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I sampled this and immediately loved the warm and clean freshness... Wonderfully aromatic, lavender and citrus does not jump at you but more so mixes softly with the mint and musk. I spritzed it all over myself, unbeknownst to me this was intended for men, until a few moments later. There was something so sensual and fervent in the powdery notes, I'd sniff and feel a slight flush from the blood rushing to my cheeks that made me feel so free and powerful... "I think this is for men... I love it." I think of a sophisticated and charming gentleman with a youthful free spirit. Like the kind of man who has not yet been hardened by spice (or something like that). Very pleasant and comforting. Peaceful. To me, there is something that slightly resembles insecticide, but in a really nice inoffensive kind of way. Not a feminine beauty, but not a dominating beast.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1946664"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1946664#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1933185" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1933185" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bfreepro417"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195501"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1195501.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bfreepro417" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versace/Versace-Pour-Homme-Oud-Noir-17338.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17338.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Versace Pour Homme Oud Noir"title="Versace Pour Homme Oud Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1933185ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1933185" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195501">Bfreepro417</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-20">09/20/23 20:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Revisiting this one, as Im packing to move to a new house and I found my old small bottle with probably 10 sprays left. I definitely remembered this as being a really classy, fresh, breezy, athletic/sporty scent. <br />
I sprayed it on myself again after not wearing it in probably two years, and was instantly reminded why I liked it in the first place. <br />
Its so sharp and invigorating on the opening, theres this really fresh, citrusy type smell- not a sweet, ripe fruit, but a juicy bitter rind, like the pure citrus acid smell from squeezing an orange peel. Its bitter and invigorating, and there is this added CRISP, green sharpness from mint- incredibly fresh, cool, and undeniably clean. These two aspects alone could easily be too much or too bitter for some, BUT, what makes this a masterpiece in my opinion- theres this underlying soft, slightly powdery roundness to it from lavender and the ambroxan in the base.<br />
Its fairly simple as far as notes, but the way its crafted and blended is absolutely masterful. Its incredibly classy and overall, the ingredients smell very high quality and natural. To me, its one I love to spray anytime when Im at home or after the gym, as its just so breezy and uplifting, and oozes a cool cleanliness no matter what. Its fresh in a bottle. It certainly does not smell like baby powder to me but it does have a powdery, warm/round vibe from the base notes, and that makes it incredibly versatile and high-class to me. <br />
<br />
I think every other fragrance in this category can maybe be a little too sweet or juicy, this one feels like a light mist of pure masculine freshness, but it does have really good longevity for a freshie. Also gives me a MODERN barbershop feeling. <br />
<br />
Compared to the other Luna Rossa line:<br />
Sport is much thicker and sweeter, in fact, I find the Luna Rossa EDT to be a better sport scent than the actual Sport flanker. I love them both though. EDT is lighter and crisper, Sport is warmer and more heavy and sweet with the vanilla/tonka bean flavor. <br />
Carbon is much spicier, more juicy and less crisp and fresh. More like a modern blue style- like sauvage or Dylan blue- sharp, modern spiciness. Luna Rossa EDT, comparatively, feels like a modern take on the sport fragrances from the 90s, like Platinum Egoiste, polo sport, stuff like that. <br />
Black is in another league as a dry, super dark, thick and rich (almost gourmand) type scent. Theyre nothing alike. <br />
<br />
Some scents with a similar vibe- <br />
Chanel allure homme sport - sweeter and less crisp, more juicy orange and less bitter orange.<br />
Dior homme cologne - lighter and less complex, almost unisex, but captures a similar natural citrus freshness up top.<br />
polo sport- both deliver this refreshing, minty quality.<br />
Light blue forever- simply due to the natural, bitter refreshing citrus note up top (bitter orange in Luna Rossa and grapefruit in Light Blue Forever)- in both its a very rind-y citrus note instead of the typical sweet citrus juice.<br />
<br />
<br />
Conclusion: I love the simplicity, clean/soapy vibe, and pure class from Luna Rossa. I quickly went out and bought a 100 ml bottle after using what was left of the 50 ml bottle I found while packing. My only regret is that I left this one on the shelf for so long!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1933185"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1933185#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1928528" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1928528" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Antmo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1319426"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1319426.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Antmo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montblanc/Starwalker-Extreme-71710.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71710.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Starwalker Extreme"title="Starwalker Extreme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1928528ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1928528" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1319426">Antmo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-15">09/15/23 07:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have to admit this is not one of my favorite fragrances. But, yesterday I really enjoyed the smell all-day long. It felt refreshing and warm somehow. I even considered buying it again. I've had it for two years, It just never felt right. Maybe I'm falling in love the my old favorite combination of lavender and sage again? I'm hooked. Replacement Bottle on the way.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1928528"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1928528#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1920041" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1920041" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bvarney_zip"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247616"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1247616.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bvarney_zip" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1920041ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1920041" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247616">bvarney_zip</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-05">09/05/23 03:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such an invigorating mint fragrance. Woody soapy mint. But mostly mint. Mint mint and more mint.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1920041"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1920041#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1903293" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1811116">Amelio77</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-16">08/16/23 01:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is very nice clean soapy powdery , i can see girls loving this cuz u will smell like a clean baby :D , i may be wrong but it also smells similar with le male leparfum to me , when i first smelled prada i immediately thought about le male le parfum they are not exactly the same  but u can tell they have the same  powdery lavander kinda vibe , le parfum is more seductive and for more cold weather and night time , prada u can wear all year any time ,   but im gonna give prada to my brother which is 30 years old i hope it suits him. cuz i also feel like young guys and teenagers can rock prada aswell its not a very mature fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Discrete, simple, versatile day time fragrance. Nothing to dislike nor blow your mind. Well blended suitable for most occassion and season. Better suited for someone in their mid to late 20s.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1902896"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1902896#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1899915" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1899915" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="molecularentropy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1515005"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1515005.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="molecularentropy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Azzaro/Wanted-Tonic-59733.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59733.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wanted Tonic"title="Wanted Tonic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1899915ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1899915" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1515005">molecularentropy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-11">08/11/23 18:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very clean, very fresh. It's no ground-breaker. You can wear this every single day to almost any casual function. I wear this thing to the gym because it smells clean and isn't a massive projector. Smells like minty toothpaste with a dash of lavender. It's soapy, for sure. Hyper-linear; dry-down is pretty close to the open, even the mintyness remains. Lasts maybe two hours strong, and then it gets weak. I bought it because I'm exploring the line, but it's not worth the money people are asking for it now, given it's discontinued. However, it is an awesome dumb-reach fragrance. Nobody will ever be put off by this one. I'll certainly be enjoying my bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1899915"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1899915#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1899908" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1889071" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shadi118"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325543"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1325543.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shadi118" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1889071ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1889071" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325543">Shadi118</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-28">07/28/23 09:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really like all Prada perfumes. They're classy and different.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1889071"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1889071#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1878643" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1878643" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tailoredshirt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/241046"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.241046.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tailoredshirt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfum-d-Empire/Corsica-Furiosa-24803.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.24803.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Corsica Furiosa"title="Corsica Furiosa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1878643ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1878643" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/241046">tailoredshirt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-14">07/14/23 11:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my dumb reach casual/office scent for warm weather. The lavender and mint combo is a nice departure from all of the citrus-heavy summer fragrances (personal preference, I wouldn't mind if the orange disappeared entirely). Smells clean and doesn't get cloying in the heat. Thumbs up.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1878643"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1878643#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1870507" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1861239" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fromthesidelines"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410259"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="fromthesidelines" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montblanc/Explorer-52002.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52002.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Explorer"title="Explorer"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1861239ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1861239" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410259">fromthesidelines</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-21">06/21/23 04:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Surprised at how underwhelmed I am by this one. There's been some hype on it recently as a great summer daytime wear that stands out. Well, it is different. I get lavender, mint, some orange in the opening and, to me, a very off-putting wet green note. Luxury mint/lavender soap. Unisex. I wanted it to be fresher, more masculine and a little more invigorating.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1861239"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1861239#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1861118" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Fresh scent, safe to wear and maybe unique. Because It was old enough.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1861118"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1861118#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1859675" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1859675" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="doodluv"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1386268"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1386268.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="doodluv" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ormonde-Jayne/4-Montabaco-Intensivo-67775.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67775.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="4. Montabaco Intensivo"title="4. Montabaco Intensivo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1859675ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1859675" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1386268">doodluv</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-19">06/19/23 04:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a complete banger. <br />
<br />
My favourite type of fragrance is probably something that is aromatic, fresh, ultra clean, professional, green-ish, with a 'cooling effect' <br />
Living in a place where summers can reach 60 degrees celsius, I can wear this sort of fragrance every day and wouldn't get bored. It's precisely how I'd like to present myself at work, especially because said work involves getting very up close and personal with people. I want to smell well put together and classy in a very clean way.<br />
The king of this genre in my humble opinion is Platinum Egoiste. Terre d'Hermes Eau Intense Vetiver is also brilliant.<br />
<br />
Luna Rossa is another of the same style. <br />
Aromatic? Check! (Lavender bomb)<br />
Clean? Check! (It's a Prada)<br />
Green + cooling effect? Check! (Nicest interpretation of mint I've smelt)<br />
<br />
It's not as masculine, sharp or dry as Platinum Egoiste or TdH. It's a lot more rounded, a bit soapy, and ever so slightly sweeter. But I don't mind one bit, it's a great alternative to them while smelling totally different.  <br />
<br />
I get decent/good performance from it as well, awesome sillage and it lasts a solid 5-6 hours, especially on clothes.<br />
<br />
Overall for me a solid 9 out of 10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1859675"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1859675#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1856677" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Decent performance/longevity, amazing profile. One of my few 10/10s.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1854940"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1854940#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1848061" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1838407" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="justinmartini314"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1441324"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="justinmartini314" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1838407ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1838407" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1441324">justinmartini314</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-21">05/21/23 06:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This I feel is one of the more underrated scents out there. Everyone talks about the flankers, but the original is always overlooked for some reason. I can see how some might think it smells generic or just ordinary but this truly is an everyday stable. I mainly get mint and lavender with this one which creates a minty yet slightly sweet scent. Some might say it smells like toothpaste which I can see but it smells like the best toothpaste ever made. I also find it super versatile but I find myself wearing this a lot in the gym as I find it smells good when heated up and it also has a sporty feel. 9.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1830444" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HikingViking"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1416622"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1416622.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HikingViking" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1830444ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1830444" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1416622">HikingViking</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-11">05/11/23 09:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Best performing EdT I own. Clean, fresh &amp; soapy very suitable for spring &amp; summer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1830444"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1830444#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1827059" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1817926" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SneezeNose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1713691"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1713691.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SneezeNose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1817926ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1817926" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1713691">SneezeNose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-26">04/26/23 07:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Classic Prada. Citrusy, clean, fresh spicy, and easy to wear. Summer appropriate. <br />
<br />
This has the best scent profile in the Luna rossa line in my opinion.  Performance is not great but you can spray as much as you want and wont offend anyone.<br />
<br />
This has ambroxan in it and I will try to layer it with molecule 01 and give an update.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1817926"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1817926#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1816620" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1470760">MB76</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-06">04/06/23 11:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This  has been one of my choices for Spring wear and today I was a little undecided if I wanted to wear this fresh aromatic gem or Mont Blanc Explorer. I decided to layer them and wow, what a nice mix. They both are ambroxan based with a citrus opening and mid green notes so theres no conflicting note mix. I do pick up a little more of the soapy clean blend of this Prada, but where the citrus dissipates fairly quickly in the Prada, Explorer comes in to boost that. I find its made for a very nice layering.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15754"comment_id="1802223"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-15754.html?ccid=1802223#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1793907" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
